thread.title: Catfish pays tribute after Robert Brian Clark dies in a motorcycle accident, aged 33
thread.title_full: Catfish pays tribute after Robert Brian Clark dies in a motorcycle accident, aged 33

author: Lara Martin
title: Catfish pays tribute after Robert Brian Clark dies in a motorcycle accident, aged 33
text:
Catfish pays tribute after Robert Brian Clark dies in a motorcycle accident, aged 33 The MTV show has paid tribute to the man, who appeared in series two Share With Jesse in their episode of Catfish - they didn't pursue a romance after the show (Photo: Facebook) Share Get celebs updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
A man who once appeared on the MTV show Catfish has died in a motorcycle accident at the age of 33. 
Robert Brian Clark passed away in December but the news was only brought to the attention of Catfish viewers this week when the latest episode paid tribute to him. 
A local news report from his Birmingham, Alabama hometown explained Robert - who went by the name Brian - was killed after a motorcycle crash flung him into the path of an oncoming vehicle. He was who he said he was (Photo: Facebook) 
His episode of Catfish aired during series two; it revolved around a girl named Jesse Bettinger who was desperately trying to track down a man she’d been speaking to for three years online. 
They'd met on Facebook via one of Jesse's friends who served in the Marines alongside Brian in Afghanistan, but she worried whether he was being truthful to her after he failed to show for a planned meeting. 
However, unlike many episodes of the show, hosted by Max Joseph and Nev Schulman, where the mystery person online is not who they say they are, in Brian’s case, he was the person in his photos and everything he’d told Jesse was true. Robert Brian Clark with Catfish host Nev Schulman (Photo: MTV) 
He also revealed to her he'd been diagnosed with PTSD after his time in the military. 
When they finally met, the pair had great chemistry, but romance beyond the show didn’t last. 
Jesse paid tribute to Brian via Facebook in December, saying: “Rest in peace, you’ll always hold a special place.” 
At the end of the most recent episode of Catfish, a memorial card to Brian flashed up on screen. Like us on Facebook
